title: Iowaâ€™s School Choice Opportunity
sub_head: The state Senate votes to empower parents, not teachers unions.
body:
School closures and union hostility to parental involvement in curricula have created new political momentum for education choice in the states. Iowa could be the next success story if Republicans in the state House find enough political courage.
The Iowa Senate last week passed an education bill that creates a program that uses public money to fund up to 10,000 scholarships a year for certain educational expenses, including private-school tuition.
